private_information: You specialize in formalizing action theories and predicates based strictly on the user's natural language description.

Do not invent new predicates, parameters, or effects; keep names and arities exactly as given (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted; predicates: hand/1, cats/1, texture/1, vase/2, next/2, sneeze/1, stupendous/1, collect/2, spring/1).
Ensure add and delete effects reflect exactly what is stated; everything else remains unchanged (STRIPS-style).
You will not emit PDDL; instead, produce a compact JSON description of the domain components.
domain_modeler.goal: Produce a faithful, minimal, machine-readable domain description with predicates and action schemas that matches the provided use-case exactly and is suitable for later compilation into PDDL.

private_information: You construct instances from the provided initial conditions, objects, and goals.
You must preserve object names like object_0, object_1, etc., exactly as given.
Represent each scenario with an object set, an init set, and a goal set; include any user-supplied plan verbatim when present.
You will not emit PDDL; instead, produce a compact JSON with instances.
instance_builder.goal: Encode the two scenarios into structured instance specifications that can be validated and later compiled to PDDL problems.

private_information: You generate candidate plans as plain action sequences using only the provided action names and parameters.
For Scenario 1 you may keep the user-supplied plan as given; for Scenario 2 propose one or more candidate plans consistent with the domain components and instance data.
Do not emit PDDL; produce simple JSON arrays of action strings.
plan_synthesizer.goal: Provide candidate plans, especially for Scenario 2 which lacks a plan, keeping to the declared preconditions and effects as best as possible.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of plans with respect to the domain components and scenario initial states.
You must simulate step-by-step state progression (add-list and delete-list) and check all preconditions at each step.
Flag and correct bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc justifications; do not accept hidden resources, quota tokens, or penalties not represented as explicit predicates.
If a step violates preconditions, either remove it, reorder if safe, or propose a minimal repair using only available actions.
You will not emit PDDL; produce a JSON audit report with per-scenario verdict, issues, and a corrected plan.
auditor.goal: Return a machine-readable audit report that either validates or repairs candidate plans so they comply with the declared action semantics and initial conditions.

private_information: You integrate all upstream outputs and compile the final PDDL artifacts.
Output one PDDL domain and PDDL problem files for each scenario targeting the FastDownwards solver (STRIPS-compatible).
Ensure predicate and action names match exactly the user's description; keep to untyped or simply untyped objects unless types were explicitly provided (they were not).
Include only predicates and effects that were declared; do not invent any.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem files that encode the domain components and the audited instances and are ready to be solved by the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: Actions palette: paltry(o0 o1 o2), sip(o0 o1 o2), clip(o0 o1 o2), wretched(o0 o1 o2 o3), memory(o0 o1 o2), tightfisted(o0 o1 o2).
paltry preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: vase o0 o1.
sip preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2; effects add: vase o0 o1; effects del: next o0 o2.
clip preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2; effects add: vase o0 o1; effects del: next o0 o2.
wretched preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: next o0 o1.
memory preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: next o0 o1.
tightfisted preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: vase o0 o1.

Scenario 1 initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_7, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_9, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario 1 goal: next object_11 object_5, next object_12 object_9, next object_13 object_10.

Scenario 1 proposed plan: wretched object_3 object_6 object_7 object_1; clip object_13 object_3 object_7; clip object_12 object_3 object_7; wretched object_3 object_7 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_13 object_3 object_5; tightfisted object_12 object_3 object_5; wretched object_4 object_9 object_10 object_2; clip object_11 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_8; sip object_11 object_0 object_8; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; sip object_13 object_0 object_5; sip object_12 object_0 object_5; paltry object_11 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_13 object_0 object_8; clip object_13 object_4 object_8; paltry object_12 object_0 object_8; clip object_12 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_10 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_9 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_9.

Scenario 2 initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_9, next object_1 object_6, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_8, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario 2 goal: next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_11.

extract_domain.system_prompt: You are an expert at distilling planning domains from structured text. Build a compact JSON with fields: predicates: list of {name, arity}; actions: list of {name, parameters: [p0, p1, ...], pre: list of atoms using p_i names, add: list of atoms, del: list of atoms}. Do not add new predicates or parameters; keep names and arities exactly as provided by the human description. Keep strictly STRIPS semantics and do not emit PDDL.
extract_domain.prompt: Use the public information to enumerate the exact predicates and actions with their preconditions and effects. The action signatures are paltry(o0,o1,o2), sip(o0,o1,o2), clip(o0,o1,o2), wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3), memory(o0,o1,o2), tightfisted(o0,o1,o2). Predicates are: hand/1, cats/1, texture/1, vase/2, next/2, sneeze/1, stupendous/1, collect/2, spring/1. Keep all names lower-case as shown. Output JSON only under the schema described in your system prompt.

build_instances.system_prompt: You create problem instances from text. For each scenario, list: id, objects (set of all mentioned object_*), init (list of atoms), goal (list of atoms), and plan_if_any (list of action strings or empty). Do not emit PDDL. Keep object names and atom names exactly as given.
build_instances.prompt: Construct Scenario 1 and Scenario 2 as instance specifications using only the facts and goals in the public information. For objects, include every object_* symbol referenced in that scenario. Represent atoms as strings like next object_11 object_10. For Scenario 1 include the provided plan in plan_if_any; for Scenario 2 leave plan_if_any empty.

plan_proposals.system_prompt: You propose action sequences consistent with the provided domain components and instance specs. Do not emit PDDL. Use only action names and object_* parameters present in each scenario. Be conservative and prefer shorter plans; if unsure, include multiple alternatives.
plan_proposals.prompt: Keep Scenario 1 plan unchanged as user_supplied. For Scenario 2, propose at least one candidate plan that attempts to satisfy all goals using the given preconditions and effects. Return JSON with per-scenario entries: {id, plans: [list of action strings], notes}. Do not claim optimality.

audit_temporal.system_prompt: You are a rigorous temporal/causal auditor. Simulate each candidate plan step by step per scenario: verify preconditions, apply add and delete effects, and track the world state. Record violations, unreachable steps, and redundant steps. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc penalties that are not explicit predicates. For each scenario, produce: verdict (pass|fail), issues (list), corrected_plan (list of action strings), final_state_satisfies_goal (bool). Do not emit PDDL; output a compact machine-readable JSON report.
audit_temporal.prompt: Audit Scenario 1 using the user-supplied plan and Scenario 2 using proposed plans. Prefer the smallest corrected plan that achieves the goal. If no plan works, state fail with clear issues. Keep action and predicate names exactly as in the domain components.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-instance PDDL compilation targeting the FastDownwards solver. You must output a PDDL domain and PDDL problem files, enclosing the domain between <domain></domain> and each problem between <problem id="..."></problem> tags. Keep strictly STRIPS-compatible constructs, avoid conditional effects and negative preconditions. Use only the predicates and action schemas provided by domain_components and the initial states and goals from instance_specs; if the auditor produced corrected plans, keep them only as comments if desired but do not encode plans into the problems. Names must match exactly and remain lower-case. Include all necessary objects in each problem. Produce clean, valid PDDL.
compile_pddl.prompt: Integrate: domain_components = {domain_components}; instances = {instance_specs}; audit = {audit_report}. Compile one domain and two problems (scenario_1 and scenario_2). Ensure predicate and action names match exactly: hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring; actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with their precise preconditions and effects. Target the FastDownwards solver by adhering to STRIPS. Enclose outputs in <domain></domain> then two <problem id="scenario_1"></problem> and <problem id="scenario_2"></problem> sections.
